Pitching Machine Optimization

January 12, 2016

Overview

Design a high capacity ball feeder that can fit different types of pitching machines and create a prototype. So we have designed a high capacity ball feeder with a hopper that sits on the ground and delivers the balls one at a time into the pitching machine.

Potential Customer

Sellers, commercials and personal users

Customer Requirement

Feed Rate of 4-10 seconds

Maximum Ball Capacity of 100-300 balls

Must Accept Baseballs and Softballs

Maximum Retail Price of $1200 (Manufacturing cost of about $400)

Easy to Move

No Jamming in the Machine

Visible Loading Indicator

Adjustable Height of 2-5 ft.

Durability

Engineering Requirement

Ball Lift rpm: 15

Hopper size: 5 cubic ft.

Diameter of Ball Path: 4”

Motor Power: 0.2 hp

5 Wheels on the bottom

Visible Delivery Tube

Proper Gear Ratios

Separator rpm: 12.5

Lift Height: 5’

Lift Blade Angle: 14”

Results

By analyzing the design using finite element analysis, the design was verified to withstand the applied stresses in a static state. As required the design selects a ball from a hundred ball and elevates the ball to the desired height of a pitching machine. The high capacity ball feeder did not meet the budget requirement due to the high cost of the client preferred motor. The high capacity ball feeder achieved all engineering requirements at a low energy efficient price.
